cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi E of Varadero Cuba and 145 mi SE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest later today and then north-northwest, tracking through the Florida Keys Sunday morning and up the southwest coast of Florida

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.warning_coast: Fernandina Beach southward around the Florida peninsula to the Aucilla River, including Lake Okeechobee and the Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, with highest impacts along the Keys, southwest coast and southeast Atlantic coast from Miami through Palm Beach County
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-73 mph) are likely; brief hurricane-force gusts possible as Irma’s center passes southwest of the port Sunday morning–afternoon.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 2–4 ft above ground along the Palm Beach County coast and intracoastal waters, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain possible, producing flash flooding in low-lying port areas and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents that could disrupt vessel movements and terminal operations.
